A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Rian Johnson has taken a valuable piece of IP which has more successfully than any other franchise crossed boundaries as epic stories of good/evil friendship\, love\, and bravery -and turned it into a 2edgy4me sophomoric essay on abandoning the past.

It's ultimately clumsily handled and poorly directed\, leaving a cast of flat and confused characters nowhere left to go in episode 9. Out of place comedy\, infuriatingly awkward interjections of ultimately undeveloped political themes\, and a bevy of new characters who weren't as interesting as the old ones chucked in the trash.

All the wrong moves were made for the wrong motivations. It feels like Rian Johnson deliberately made all his film-making decisions in order to spite his audience rather than to move the ball forward.
